author: jalvaradofls
title: Aventuras Zooplanktasticas: Comic
description: Young people are the future of ecological sustainability and the social well-being of the Yucatan peninsula.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to "establish indicators to acknowledge biological connectivity and the contamination of karstic systems’ groundwater". There is no reference in the proposal to Cardano, or any apps building on Cardano. The proposal could benefit the ecology of the planet, but it is dubious how it would benefit Cardano directly. The proposer does not answer how the proposal addresses the Challenge objectives and I also fail to see how it does. The proposal doesn't scale as it does not have a tangible benefit for Cardano
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal suggests to organize digital workshops with government and private sector, to consolidate a comic [book] called "Zooplanktastic Adventures" and contribute to the decision making in the youth sector on preserving microscopic life and mitigating the adverse effects of water pollution. The proposer does not provide a linkedin profile, or a academic references, but after searching for his name it leads to an academic page at a university in Mexico. The budget is set at 93k and is split by categories on which it will be spent, the biggest one is 30k for compensation for a Biological Technician and Graphics designed for the comic book. No timeline is given. At a relatively high budget, there is good credibility that it will be delivered, but what ever is delivered does not have a link back to Cardano.

I would suggest that the proposer elaborates on if and how the comic series can added as possibly NFTs on Cardano and sell the originals as collectibles?!
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal outlines the goals of registering the name and logo for the comic series, create and register characteris for the series, storyboard design, publish 4 issues of the comic series. There is an objective deliverable, however there is lack of detail on the tracked KPIs and the proposal lacks a time schedule

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers wish to create an open science comic to communicate ecological sustainability. While this definitely is an interesting topic and quite relevant in our time and age, I rate the proposal two stars, as the proposers fail to state how this relates to the Cardano ecosystem or blockchain technology. To receive a higher rating I would recommend the proposers to describe how the project addresses the specific challenge and explain the value of their proposal to the Cardano ecosystem. All in all the proposal feels incomplete, with statements such as “no information” in several places.
f6_assessments.q1: While the proposers do address their plan for the proposal, it is rather short and vague for a project stretching over two years. Furthermore, the reader receives no information about the team members that will be involved in the project, which makes it hard to assess whether the project is feasible. For example, the proposers wish to publish a comic every three months and arrange a keynote conference with each issue. Whether this is possible greatly depends on the experience and size of the team that works with the project. To receive a higher rating and strengthen the credibility of the proposal I would recommend the proposers to provide information about the team and further specify their project plan and timeline.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposers provide no explicit metrics or KPIs that allows community members to audit the success of the project. However,  the proposers do state several milestones that should be reached along the way to be able to launch the comic. To receive a higher rating I would recommend the proposers to address what project success looks like and provide the reader with measurable KPIs to make sure that the project can deliver on its goals. Examples of such KPIs could be “by issue 5 we should have X number of readers”. This would strengthen the proposal and make it easier to be reviewed and verified by the Cardano community.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement and proposed solution are clear, however it is not clear how the funded proposal will contribute to the cardano ecosystem. It does not explain how it will address the challenge question: was this challenge valuable to the community?

The idea has potential, but this proposal does not clearly articulate how funding the proposal will add value to the cardano community. The proposer has listed interesting and artistic NFT's on the Ethereum blockchain, but not on Cardano. It would be good to see this work being displayed on Cardano and contributing to the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is to create a scientific and educational comic book, but no information is provided in the proposal about the team or the proposers relevant skills and abilities pertaining to the creation of and publishing a comic book. The budget is outlined and broken down, however it is quite high at $93,346 and it does include significant expenses including equipment such as camera and computer hardware, and it is unclear why they are needed. Additionally, the large budget covers the hiring and purchasing of everything required, therefore it is not clear what exactly the proposer brings to the challenge, and what skills and assets they are providing. This proposal could be improved by showing a proof of concept, storyboard, or sample of the comic, and more information about the team involved.
f6_assessments.q2: The audibility of this project is straightforward, as it would be determined by the deliverable of at least four issues in the second year after receiving funding. However, it is not clear how the cardano community would audit and track the progress, as it would be up to the proposer to audit themselves until the point when the comic is published. While there is intrinsic value to this scientific / educational / creative work, It is not clear how the completion of this comic would benefit the cardano ecosystem and ada holders.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer finds a problem and offers a partial and potential solution, but at no point does it connect the problem and the solution with the Cardano network.
 
This challenge, the "Miscellaneous Challenge", is the one with the fewest requirements to participate with a project. But it does have a requirement: to be related in some way to Cardano. And this project fails to answer this one requirement. In fact, it leaves the question "Please describe how your proposed solution will address the challenge?" without information.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project timetable is well done, and the budget is well broken down, however it is not reasonable at all. Asking for almost 25 percent of the challenge funds to make a comic is beyond excessive.
 
On the other hand, although the proponent describes himself as a scientist who could help in the realization of this project, at no time does he attach a link that demonstrates his profession and skills. Also, to make a comic, you need, at least, a writer and an illustrator in the team, and it seems that this project still does not have anyone with these characteristics. Or at least someone like that is not stated in the project.
 
To fund a comic, I consider it fair to at least recount a plot line or show previous artwork. Two things that would help with the feasibility of this particular project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proponent does not provide clear milestones or KPIs to make it easier for the community to audit this project. In fact, he leaves one of the two answers blank.
 
These two requirements cannot be missing in any proposal since the community must have tools to be able to audit the projects it funds.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal brings an issue that I couldn't identify its relation to the Cardano ecosystem. I would suggest that the proponent better explain how he intends to establish a relationship between the problem and the solution presented with cardano's ecosystem. The proposal needs to be complemented in order to make possible for us to assess correctly. The proposal has to be at least filled at the key points like how the proposed solution will address the challenge, the team members, goals and metrics that explain better the project and why would it add value to Cardano ecosystem, etc.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal explains some milestones and goals but I can't see where Cardano ecoystem would be relationated with them. The proposer could explain better about the ideas he has to this project such as how the team has to be formed and what would be the formal education and experiences of the members, what are the goals and metrics that would be used to understand the project feasibility, expose with more details the risks and challenges the project would face and the actions to mitigate them. In conclusion, I think it's not possible to assess the feasibility of this project with the infomation we have. I suggest that the proposer read carefully all the feedbacks and improve the proposal in order to complete the missing information.
f6_assessments.q2: I think the proposal needs to be improved in some points to be audit. The proposer can improve the proposal auditability by pointing some KPI's that can measure the project progress and success; describing better how the problem can be solved by the presented solution, always thinking that Cardano ecosystem has to be impacted by this solution too; presenting milestones that mean the project success and they have to be able to be goals with deadlines to happen. I think if the proposer adds these kind of information above we will be able to undestand better the proposal and how would be its auditability.

solution: The aim is to generate ecological empowerment. We understand that it is necessary and important to provide high-quality information.
experience: Specialist in ecotoxicology and diversity of zooplankton species. Coordinator of the Ecotoxicology Laboratory. The goal of the current research is to establish indicators to acknowledge biological connectivity and the contamination of karstic systems’ groundwater.
